Repository Name Unauthorized: District of Columbia Public Library, Washingtoniana Division
Notes: The Washingtoniana Collection was established in 1905 when Library Director, Dr. George F. Bowerman, had the foresight to start collecting books and articles about the local community. Washingtoniana houses an array of resources and materials from the late 18th century to the present, with a primary focus on the local city. In addition to the resources listed below, Washingtoniana also includes Prints & Photographs, the DC Community Archives and the Peabody Room for Georgetown neighborhood history.
